1.text: The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him:

2.text: What, my son? and what, O son of my womb? and what, O son of my vows?

3.text: Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways to them that destroy kings.

4.text: It is not for kings, Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine, nor for rulers [to say], Where is the strong drink?

5.text: lest they drink And forget the law, And pervert the judgment of any of the children of affliction.

6.text: Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto the bitter of soul:

7.text: let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.

8.text: Open thy mouth for the dumb, for the cause of all those that are left desolate.

9.text: Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and minister justice to the afflicted and needy.

10.text: Who can find a woman of worth? for her price is far above rubies.

11.text: The heart of her husband confideth in her, and he shall have no lack of spoil.

12.text: She doeth him good, and not evil, all the days of her life.

13.text: She seeketh wool and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands.

14.text: She is like the merchants’ ships: she bringeth her food from afar;

15.text: And she riseth while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household, and the day’s work to her maidens.

16.text: She considereth a field, and acquireth it; of the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.

17.text: She girdeth her loins with strength, and maketh strong her arms.

18.text: She perceiveth that her earning is good; her lamp goeth not out by night.

19.text: She putteth her hands to the distaff, and her hands hold the spindle.

20.text: She stretcheth out her hand to the afflicted, and she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.

21.text: She is not afraid of the snow for her household; for all her household are clothed with scarlet.

22.text: She maketh herself coverlets; her clothing is byssus and purple.

23.text: Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.

24.text: She maketh body linen and selleth it, and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.

25.text: Strength and dignity are her clothing, and she laugheth [at] the coming day.

26.text: She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and upon her tongue is the law of kindness.

27.text: She surveyeth the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.

28.text: Her children rise up and call her blessed; her husband [also], and he praiseth her:

29.text: Many daughters have done worthily, but thou excellest them all.

30.text: Gracefulness is deceitful and beauty is vain; a woman [that] feareth Jehovah, she shall be praised.

31.text: Give her of the fruit of her hands, and let her own works praise her in the gates.
